sentences.sContent: Sin can never quite bereave a saint of his jewel his grace; but it may steal away the key of the cabinet his assurance.
sentences.sContent_eng: Sin can never quite bereave a saint of his jewel his grace; but it may steal away the key of the cabinet his assurance.
sentences.sCn: 罪恶全然无法夺去圣徒的珠宝，就是他所得到恩典；但是罪恶可以偷走珠宝柜的钥匙，那就是确据。

remMethod.val: be + reave(抢夺) → 抢夺掉 → 丧亲； reave本身是一个单词

words.tran: 丧失的；被剥夺的；失去亲人的
使丧失（bereave的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to deprive (of) something or someone valued, esp through death
